description: The descriptive statistic of a set of measurements. A measurement value can be the result of combining various measurements and calculating descriptive statistics like average, maximum, minimum, etc. Additional descriptive statistics will be added as the need arises. A measurement value without a descriptive statistic is interpreted as being the result of an individual measurement.

references.description: The NCIT code represents Median (Statistical Measurement)
The NCIT code represents Standard Deviation
The NCIT code represents Percentile, any of the 99 numbered points that divide an ordered set of scores into 100 parts each of which contains one-hundredth of the total.
The NCIT code represents Percentile, any of the 99 numbered points that divide an ordered set of scores into 100 parts each of which contains one-hundredth of the total.
The NCIT code represents Quartile, any of four equal-sized sets of observations in a ranked sample.
The NCIT code represents Quartile, any of four equal-sized sets of observations in a ranked sample.
In a distribution, partial variance between the upper quartile and lower quartile (semi inter quartile range).
One of the four values that divide the items of a frequency distribution into five classes with each containing one fifth of the total population.
